text.__SUMMARY__: Lovellona atramentosa is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Mitromorphidae.
text.Description:
The shell size varies between 5 mm and 13 mm
The shell is encircled by finely pricked grooves. It has a chestnut-color with generally a few white spots on the shoulder, and is white-tinted at the base.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Indian Ocean off the Aldabra Atoll, Mozambique and KwaZuluNatal, in the Indo-West Pacific.
text.References:
